title: What if France refused to sell Louisiana to the United States, but decided to give Louisiana independence in 1803? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: We probably would've taken it from them during the revolution or during the Franco Prussian war. The European empires were in collapse by the rise of the US shown by the very fact that we broke away from Britain. Mexico broke from Spain. Then the US cut Mexico in half. The only nations that showed any since on the matter were Spain in selling Florida, France in selling louisiana and Britain eventually in forgoing claims on the colonies after the war of 1812. It showed they knew the land they had was too much to be beneficial to them and it would have been a hastle to keep it from us

In the 1790s refugees from the Haitian Revolution arrived. These would still have been natural allies of the US South planters against slave revolt. Many Spanish settlers left at the end of Spanish rule. Not clear if this would be different. The Anglo-American demographic expansion would still be a rising tide about to reach the area.
